definition: to soar/to glide/variant of 詳|详[xiang2]

pinyin: xuan2 gua4 shi4 hua2 xiang2 ji1

sentences.english: He flies a motor  glider and small airplanes.
sentences.chinese: 現在他可以駕駛電動滑翔機和小型飛機。

sentences.english: Currents of warm air keep the hang-gliders aloft.
sentences.chinese: 懸掛式滑翔機藉着暖氣流在高空飛行。

sentences.english: Power -driven heavier - than -air aircraft shall give way to gliders.
sentences.chinese: 重於空氣的動力驅動飛機應該給滑翔機讓路。

sentences.english: The glider uncoupled from the two planes.
He flew over the Great Wall in a paraglider .
sentences.chinese: 他駕着滑翔傘飛越了長城。

sentences.english: This would make the glider rise and fall as it entered warm and cold patches of water.
sentences.chinese: 這能讓滑翔器在進入暖水域上升，在進入冷領域下降。

sentences.english: Fly Fish, Parasailing for one round, Jet Ski for 15 minute.
sentences.chinese: 飛魚，水上滑翔傘一趟，摩托艇15分鐘。

sentences.english: Glide base of Changping is the gliding fans' heaven.
sentences.chinese: 昌平的滑翔基地是滑翔愛好者的天堂。

sentences.english: Glide base of Changping is the gliding fans' heaven.
sentences.chinese: 昌平的滑翔基地是滑翔愛好者的天堂。

sentences.english: British paratroopers writing slogans on their Horsa gliding plane.
sentences.chinese: 寫在他們的滑翔機霍薩英國傘兵的口號。

sentences.english: The man who first experimented with sailplanes hoped to imitate the flight of birds.
sentences.chinese: 首先使用滑翔機作實驗的人是想模仿鳥的飛行。

sentences.english: I hope this article will help everyday pilots understand how paragliders are actually designed.
sentences.chinese: 我希望這篇文章能幫助大家理解滑翔傘是怎麼設計的。

sentences.english: The colugo could tell a tale of nocturnal gliding through the forests of South East Asia.
sentences.chinese: 貓猴的故事是一個滑翔縱橫於夜間東南亞森林的故事。

sentences.english: We drove all the way here to Yehliu to go hang gliding and now you're going to chicken out?
sentences.chinese: 我們一路開到野柳來玩滑翔翼，而你現在想落跑？

sentences.english: It was as if the glider wasn't there.
sentences.chinese: 這種感覺，就好像滑翔機根本就不在我身上一樣。

sentences.english: How does the brake act on the paraglider airfoil?
sentences.chinese: 剎車是如何作用於滑翔傘的翼型？

definition: to slide/to coast/to glide/(of an aircraft) to taxi
to circle in the air/to soar
to dive down fast/to swoop down
to rise to the sky/to lift off/to levitate/liftoff
be high up in the sky
to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
